quest.name: Return to the Crystarium
journal: G'raha Tia has something he wishes to give you.
objectives: Wait for Lyna in front of the Cabinet of Curiosity.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Final Days─how far has the phenomenon spread, and how does it manifest itself in each land? I must reach out to my friends in each nation and find out all I can.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Ahhh...!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, I suppose I do feel better on a full stomach, after all. Burning skies? Blasphemies? Not if I've got anything to say about it!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Should Ryne ask questions, don't hide the truth from her. If anything, see if she has any insights to offer.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: She's not a child in need of protection, but a comrade we should be willing to rely upon. Even if a part of me may always beg to differ.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If the Forum truly has been spurred to action by Hydaelyn's prophecy, then is it not odd that the Antitower was entrusted to Master Matoya, who bears them no love?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: No doubt She has a reason for this, and I would know what it is...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Beasts and blasphemies may be running amok in nearby lands outside the influence of Radz–at–Han and the alliance. If so, I may need to go hunting.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Take this, Forename─my spirit vessel.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Empty now, of course, but it should allow you to operate the tower's systems in the Umbilicus.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: If even the smallest fragment of Elidibus's essence remains, it should be possible to locate it.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: As for access to the Umbilicus, pray seek out Lyna for assistance. Chances are she still stands watch at the Accensor Gate.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Should she or anyone else ask after me, tell them...I am living my life to the fullest. That I am happy, hardships and all.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: ...Well, we had best be on our respective ways. Gods willing, we will see each other again ere long.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Forename! You are returned!

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Have you been well? You and the others...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: As well as can be.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We've no shortage of troubles, but we're well enough.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Full glad am I to hear that. I trust my lord is enjoying himself.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Then things are much the same for you as they were here. My lord is doubtless enjoying himself.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: He...he said this to you? These exact words?

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Oh, to know that he is happy... It fills my heart with joy.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. For taking care of him.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: When next you see him, please tell him not to overexert himself. Futile a request though it is.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: And tell him that all is well here.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: The peace you gifted us continues, and we work hard to build new lives for ourselves.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: In the course of this we occasionally bicker, but we've never been more optimistic for the morrow.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: If I had to mention one dilemma, it would be the question of our governance. Even as we speak, debate rages on over how we should run the city in the Exarch's absence.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Most are of a mind that the Settlement council should continue to oversee the general running of the Crystarium, while representatives are elected to determine policy and handle diplomacy.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Thus far nothing is set in stone, but however we choose to proceed, we will not replace our lord. No one could.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: ...Have we recently observed any unusual phenomena?

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: No, I cannot say there have been. Curious that you should ask me this question, though...

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Some days ago, Ryne came and asked the very same. She was rather unsettled─in stark contrast to how cheerful she has been of late.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: She and other Crystarium youths just hosted a festival, you see.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: It proved so popular that there are already plans for another celebration─one much bigger than the first.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Between her preparations for the festival and the restoration of the Empty, she struck me as happy and full of life.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Ryne has been dedicating herself to the restoration of the Empty, you see.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Though it will take many long years, the goal seems to have given her a newfound sense of purpose and fulfillment.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: So when I saw her in a state of such worry, I couldn't help but feel worried in turn. Especially since she wouldn't tell me what troubled her.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: I daresay she would be more willing to confide in you. May I ask you to broach the subject with her?

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: You wish to enter the Umbilicus? Very well. I shall fetch the key at once─and take the opportunity to find Ryne.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Please wait for me in the city, in front of the Cabinet of Curiosity, shall we say. I will be along as soon as I can.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The following event cannot be skipped. You may wish to cancel any pending Duty Finder registrations.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Wait for Lyna?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: (-???-)...Do my old eyes deceive? Is that truly Forename?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Hah, it is! Full glad am I to see you hale and whole, my friend!

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: What a wonderful surprise it is to have you back with us─and at this most opportune time!

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: In case you haven't heard, we are planning to produce a tome chronicling events from the Flood to the night's return.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: For this project, we intend to draw upon records kept by the world's peoples.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Historical and contemporary firsthand accounts will be the centerpiece of the tome, but yours would be the one to crown them all!

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I've been asked to contribute a chapter on the soul─a subject that is key to understanding much of your endeavors.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: In the course of developing the spirit vessel, I gained valuable insights into travel beyond the rift. Knowledge that will allow me to attest to your existence and deeds!

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: There is no end to the questions I would ask you, but if you could indulge me just one for now...

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: In your quest to restore the night, you faced many a formidable foe.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Among them, who offered you the greatest struggle?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Titania, driven mad by Light and loneliness.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Vauthry, in his misguided self-righteousness.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Hades, who bore the burden of his people.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: This may come as a surprise, but...

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Ah yes, Titania, the fallen faerie king. Against such a fiendishly playful opponent, I can well imagine that even the Warrior of Darkness must have struggled.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: But you succeeded in setting them free, and your victory proved a pivotal moment in your quest. We will see that it features prominently in the tome!

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Ah yes, Lord Vauthry, former leader of Eulmore and the final Lightwarden you cast down. Building his paradise on Mt. Gulg, he proclaimed his existence immaculate and took the name Innocence.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Your reckoning with him was, without a doubt, a defining moment in history, and we will see that it features prominently in the tome!

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Ah yes, Hades, he who sought to resurrect his ancient brethren. He was the final obstacle in your quest to restore the night; your battle in the depths of the Tempest the stuff of epics.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Yet compelling as it is, I worry that mere words wouldn't do justice to that fateful confrontation...

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Not that we would think to omit it entirely, of course. No, at the very least, we will impress upon readers that it was the climax of your hero's journey.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: T-Truly? I never would have guessed... But then if I could, I suppose I wouldn't have had to ask.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: 'Tis a tremendously eye-opening answer, and we will see that your account of this battle features prominently in the tome!

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I know you'd love to talk herhis ear off, Moren, but we really should be on our way. Those documents from Eulmore won't collect themselves.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Of course, of course. And afterwards, would you care to join me for tea? I was hoping you might clarify a few points in your treatise...

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Till next time, then. Do tell the others to look after themselves.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Our overzealous friend, in particular─remind him not to overexert himself. Again and again till his ears fall off, if that's what it takes for him to take it to heart.

dialogue.name: ARKIL
dialogue.text: (-???-)<gasp> Is that the Warrior of Darkness!?

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: It's herhim! It's really herhim! What are you doing here?

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: If you're going to battle, I can give you some medicine! I made it myself!

dialogue.name: EIRWEL
dialogue.text: Best not, Riqi. You'd only give herhim a stomachache.

dialogue.name: EIRWEL
dialogue.text: We've come to see Moren. To get his advice.

dialogue.name: EIRWEL
dialogue.text: One of the guard finally agreed to teach us how to fight. But first, we need to choose a fighting style.

dialogue.name: EIRWEL
dialogue.text: While I know that I want to be a mage, Arkil isn't sure.

dialogue.name: ARKIL
dialogue.text: Magic isn't really my thing. So I was thinking of taking up the axe. Or the sword. Or maybe the bow!

dialogue.name: ARKIL
dialogue.text: They all seem all right, but it's hard to decide, so I thought I'd ask Moren. He knows about lots of things.

dialogue.name: ARKIL
dialogue.text: He isn't here? Awww...

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Ooh, ooh! Why don't you have the Warrior of Darkness choose for you?

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: What do you think suits Arkil best? Axe, sword, or bow?

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: For smiting your opponent, the axe.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: For protecting your friends, the sword.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: For fighting and hunting both, the bow.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: The axe... If you took up the axe, you could be just like...

dialogue.name: CRYSTALIUMCHILDREN
dialogue.text: (-All-)Ardbert, the Warrior of Light!

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: The sword... If you took up the sword, you could be just like...

dialogue.name: CRYSTALIUMCHILDREN
dialogue.text: (-All-)Branden, the Warrior of Light!

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: The bow... If you took up the bow, you could be just like...

dialogue.name: CRYSTALIUMCHILDREN
dialogue.text: (-All-)Renda-Rae, the Warrior of Light!

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: I love that tale! Let's borrow the book today!

dialogue.name: EIRWEL
dialogue.text: It's really popular, though. I hope it's still there...

dialogue.name: ARKIL
dialogue.text: Thanks for helping me decide, Warrior of Darkness! I'll start with that style, and maybe try something else later on.

dialogue.name: ARKIL
dialogue.text: And when I get really strong, I hope to have a bout with you!

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: (-???-)Hmph... Such fun shehe's been having basking in the adoration of musty old bookworms and wide-eyed younglings, but does shehe spare a thought for me? Of course not!

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: (-???-)I waited and waited and waited, but shehe won't so much as acknowledge the presence of herhis beautiful branch even though they're right here! Such a heartless thing our sapling is! Cold and cruel and heartless!

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Uh...Feo Ul? I...er, need you?

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: O faithful Feo Ul, loveliest of branches! How I have missed you!

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Don't you have more important things to do, Your Majesty?

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: Why do you say it like a question!? Where's the love, the respect─the awe!?

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: ...But disappointed as I am, I'll overlook it this once. I know you have a lot on your mind right now.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: If you truly missed me, you should have cried for me at the top of your lungs the instant you arrived!

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: To make up for it, you will call with twice the passion next time. Though for there to be a next time, you've some few struggles to overcome.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: I've no end of important tasks to attend to, but unlike some, I know what my priorities should be! And since when did my sapling become a twisted old tree that says such unkind things!?

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: ...But disappointed as I am, I'll overlook it this once. I know you have a lot on your mind right now.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: So, my adorable sapling. The world is on the verge of destruction, is it?

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: Hehe, how do I know this? Joined as we are, spying on you is as simple as sliding down the back of a rainbow.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: Would that I could aid you in your quest...but the fate of we fae folk is bound to that of the star. Whither it goes, so too do we follow. Such is our way.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: The most I could do for you is spare you the pain, by gifting you the sweetest of eternal dreams...

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: But if escape's not to your liking, then you must struggle with your fellow mortals.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: Ah, but here are the ones you were waiting for. I wonder, what manner of conclusion awaits at tale's end...?

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: My apologies for the delay.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Forename! It's so wonderful to see you again!

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: You doubtless have much catching up to do, so I shall leave you to it. I've taken the liberty of unlocking the Umbilicus, and you may enter at your leisure.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'm relieved to hear that everyone is well.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I've had this feeling, like a pit in my stomach, and I was afraid that something might have happened...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Maybe I'm overthinking things, but...it's just that...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'm the Oracle of Light, but I've never spoken with Hydaelyn. Never once heard Her call.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Even so, I've always had this feeling deep inside me. A connection to something immense.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: These past few days, though, that connection has...wavered. As if that immense something was distant, then close, then distant again...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: And then, the other night, I was jolted awake by the feeling it had been completely severed.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Wanting some fresh air, I went to open the window...and to my horror, the sky was ablaze. Like during the starshower...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: But then I blinked, and everything was normal. The next day, no one said a thing. No one else had seen what I had seen.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: As far as I could tell, nothing was out of the ordinary. I began to wonder if it was a figment of a half-remembered dream...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Forename...? What are you not telling me?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I have to know─please! It doesn't matter how terrible it is!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It wasn't my imagination, then. The doom we witnessed in Amaurot has come again...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I can't believe it...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Like I told you before, all is well here in the First.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: So don't worry about us. Please. Look only to the threat before you.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: We're fine right now, and even if we weren't, we've learned how to survive.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Should the Final Days reach us here as well, you may be assured we won't go quietly.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: No, we'll hold on until you can find a way to save all our worlds.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: So long as you continue your fight, so too will we, united in purpose beneath a blazing sky.
